newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan loan defaulters to pay 20bln rupees.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan loan defaulters to pay 20bln rupees.

text.p: The State (central) Bank of Pakistan (SBP) said on Saturday 20,777 loan defaulters had pledged to pay back 20 billion rupees ($492 million) under an incentive scheme for the settlement of loans.

An SBP statement said the bank had informed a committee for the recovery of loans and revival of sick industrial units that the defaulters had committed themselves to paying back the money under the one-time incentive scheme.
The SBP has told all banks to file complaints before courts against all loan defaulters who fail to make a loan settlement by September 5 under the scheme.

Recent banking reforms introduced by Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif's government have given wide powers to high court judges and banking courts to recover loans currently estimated at 127 billion rupees ($3.13 billion).
